description.@value: Edge Translator converts known ontologies on fly to a shared pivotal ontology either on-device or at server side. Use case could be 'User do have her cv with French ROME skills-tags and she wants to apply jobs in FInland applying Finnhish language version of ESCO. For use the translation is invisble and happens in background, because on-device Edge Translation, that first converts French ROME to French ESCO and then French ESCO to Finnish ESCO. The Finnsih ESCO skills-tags are then further applied applied when matching the skills against Finnish labour market data.' On-device translators are meant to decrease network and computing consumption while server-side conversions could have better performance. This buildng block enables external translation services to be connected / included into the process. This building block is known to support e.g. BB07 Distributed Data Visualisation and all between-ontologies and between-languages activities inside Data Space. The Translator aim to work on data at rest or in a live environment during a data exchange.

functionalities.@value: Edge Translator is a critical component in all between-ontologies and between-languages activities inside Data Space.
Edge Translator will help jobs and skills data interoperability by transforming the data-format from multiple sources to a same standard format.
Edge Translator AI will help to find matchings between source's skills and ESCO and provide matching suggestions improvements with the usage.
